title: VLOOKUP_RECORD
description: Retrieves one record that matches the specified field-value pairs from a given object and returns the full Object record.

parameters.name: lookup_object_name
parameters.description: The name of the object to look up.

parameters.name: ...matching_field_name
parameters.description: The name of the field used to match records.

parameters.name: ...matching_field_value
parameters.description: The field value used as matching criteria.

parameters.name: additional_clause_optional
parameters.description: Additional query conditions for more precise filtering.

examples:
VLOOKUP_RECORD("Opportunity", 
        "AccountId", Id, 
        "IsClosed = true")
-- Retrieve a Opportunity record where:
-- AccountId matches the current record's Id
-- IsClosed equals true

VLOOKUP_RECORD("Opportunity", 
        "AccountId", Id, 
        "OwnerId", OwnerId, 
        "Probability > 90")
-- Retrieves a Opportunity record where:
-- AccountId matches the current record's Id
-- OwnerId matches the current record's OwnerId
-- Probability is greater than 90

tips.text: Use VLOOKUP_RECORD under the “Related” tab in the “Variables” section. There you can also set the variable’s Scope—Executable, Pipeline, Connection, or Global.
After the object is retrieved, reference its fields in the Mapping step (e.g., #accountVar.Name, #accountVar.OwnerId) to populate target fields.
SOQL queries are capped at 50,000 returned rows per transaction; refine your filters or apply additional indexing to prevent your lookup from exceeding this governor limit.
